On Sep 22, 2012, at 10:51 AM, Jan Algermissen wrote:

> 
> On Sep 22, 2012=
, at 10:41 AM, Steve Klabnik wrote:
> 
> > "Cool URIs don't change" is not =
a RESTful principle.
> 
> I said "best practice", not "principle".
> 
> And=
 IMHO, striving for keeping URIs stable is a key ingredient of making RESTf=
ul systems work despite their inherent non-coupling.


Consider this:

Supp=
ose Joe developer is facing the task of changing some server implementation=
. Is he free to drop all previous URIs and come up with a bunch of new ones=
?

Free? yes, but a good idea? No.

Why? Bookmarking!

And there's your bes=
t practice already. I simply aim to make people aware of it.

Jan





> 
>=
 Jan
